pois.name: Mosteiro dos Jerónimos
pois.short_description: A UNESCO World Heritage monastery in Lisbon.
pois.description: The Monastery of Santa Maria de Belém, better known as the Jerónimos Monastery, is a Portuguese monastery, built at the end of the 15th century by King Manuel I and dedicated to the Order of Saint Jerome. It is located in the parish of Belém, in the city and municipality of Lisbon.

pois.name: Museu Nacional do Azulejo
pois.short_description: A museum dedicated to Portuguese tile art.
pois.description: Explore centuries of azulejo history, from traditional patterns to large-scale panels and contemporary works.

pois.name: Time Out Market
pois.short_description: Food hall with many local dishes in one place.
pois.description: A lively market featuring multiple vendors with Portuguese classics and modern cuisine. Great for groups and trying variety.

pois.name: Parque Florestal de Monsanto
pois.short_description: The largest green park in Lisbon for walks and views.
pois.description: A huge forested area with trails, picnic spots, viewpoints, and a break from the city noise.

pois.name: MAAT (Museum of Art, Architecture and Technology)
pois.short_description: Modern museum by the river with striking architecture.
pois.description: A contemporary museum space and landmark building—great for exhibitions, photos, and a riverside walk.

pois.name: Pastéis de Belém
pois.short_description: Famous bakery for the original pastel de nata recipe.
pois.description: A historic pastry shop near major monuments—perfect for tasting the classic custard tart fresh from the oven.
